La fille du RER (The girl on the train)

Let's meet for this movie about a real event that occurred in Paris. There's a very similar event that occurred late last year in Australia that caused riots and death threats against Australians in India - and is still causing major cross-cultural incidents to this day in Australian-Indian relations.

Where: Cable Car Cinema
204 south main street
providence, rhode island
Ph: 401.272.3970
When: Wed 3 March 6:15pm (movie starts at 6:30pm)
Tickets: $8.50 general admission; $6.50 student admission

We'll meet outside the cinema at 6pm to make sure we get tickets. If you can't make it until about 6.15, let me know and I'll buy a ticket for you. It's important to go in by 6:15 because seating is limited and we'd like to sit together if possible.

After the movie, we can go for a coffee or stay for the next movie "Francaise" that screens at 9pm.

More details about the film are below.

Stevie
____________________
La fille du RER (The girl on the train)
DIRECTED BY André Téchiné
France | 2009 | 105 m
CAST Catherine Deneuve, Emilie Dequenne, Michel Blanc
View trailer (in French with subtitles)Lafilledurer

Andre Téchiné's many admirers will not be disappointed by his latest offering. In the words of one of the main characters, the film is ostensibly "the story of a lie," but as always with this director, the pleasures reside in the fine detail rather than the broad sweep. Téchiné's starting point is a true story that provoked a controversy in France five years ago: a young woman claimed to have been the victim of an anti-Semitic attack on a Paris commuter train, creating a media uproar that drew in even the head of state. But in the end, the affair was revealed to be a hoax. Téchiné is less interested by the case itself than its impact on the lives of the family and friends surrounding the girl: her mother, her lover, and her best friends who have to choose sides.
